name: nytimes
text: A New York City police union’s Twitter account was suspended on Monday after the union posted a police report on the arrest of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s daughter that contained her personal details, including her address https://t.co/Jl3edt9LG4

name: nytimes
text: William Barr has long held an expansive view of presidential power. With multiple crises converging in the run-up to the 2020 election, he is busy putting his theories to work, @Schwartzesque reports for @NYTmag https://t.co/HtAo0waMKZ

name: nytimes
text: Louisville's mayor fired the city’s police chief after learning that officers' body cameras were not activated when David McAtee, the owner of a local restaurant, was killed after police and National Guard troops shot toward protesters early Monday morning https://t.co/F9xYNNxlGZ https://t.co/5p0nUFmn5q

name: nytimes
text:
Protesters in New York have stopped traffic in both directions on Manhattan's FDR Drive. Some cars trapped on the road are honking in unison with the crowd, which is cheering: “Say his name!”

Follow the latest from our reporters on the ground. https://t.co/XBcGN227gm https://t.co/R3iGVPK9Sx

name: nytimes
text: RT @migold: UPDATE: NYC will have a curfew tomorrow night, starting at 8 pm. That's 3 hours earlier than tonight's. https://t.co/bjFKjg5lQD

name: nytimes
text: After weeks of virtual events, Joe Biden on Monday met with community leaders at Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church, a black church in Delaware, as the U.S. entered another day of unrest in response to the killing of George Floyd https://t.co/1VteamltCa

name: nytimes
text: This was the scene outside of the White House on Monday as police used tear gas and flash grenades to clear out peaceful protesters so President Trump could visit the nearby St. John’s Church, where there was a parish house basement fire Sunday night https://t.co/nFrCqYpqZR https://t.co/DVP11iiVIh

text:

name: nytimes
text:

"We rely on the over-incarceration of our society"

name: nytimes
text: A U.S. Army Blackhawk helicopter used a "show of force" maneuver on protesters in Washington, D.C. on Monday night. It's a tactic often conducted by low-flying jets in combat zones to scare away insurgents. https://t.co/g9kocdpz8G https://t.co/yMvx6eVuWZ

text:

text: RT @nytopinion: Americans are expressing a rage born of despair that their government has failed to provide one of the most fundamental protections in the Constitution: the right to life, and to not be deprived of that life without due process of law. name: nytimes
text: President Trump prompted outrage after peaceful protesters outside the White House were dispersed with tear gas so that he could pose for photos at a church while holding a Bible https://t.co/rYUkJacCCZ

name: nytimes
text:
A citywide curfew went into effect at 11 p.m., the first time New York City has had such a curfew in over 70 years. But crowds grew in Brooklyn. 

Live updates: https://t.co/kbSgKrwfCP https://t.co/XWNiIIU2Gl

name: nytimes
text:
Tens of thousands of protesters began another week of demonstrations and disturbances on Monday night, returning to the streets of cities around the country despite curfew orders and threats of arrest.

For live updates: https://t.co/ElSbxKzaIE

https://t.co/0lQ6Hhpxgi

name: nytimes
text: The New York Knicks won't make a statement on the death of George Floyd, the franchise’s owner told employees. The decision makes the Knicks an exception in a league where players and coaches have called for change on social media and joined protests. https://t.co/z8H9qtsZJ9

name: nytimes
text: RT @NYTNational: In one week since the death of George Floyd, the toll has continued to mount. In the unrest that has followed, at least five others have died and many others have been injured across the country. https://t.co/ex2uBo4kvD

name: nytimes
text: Winston, a pug whose saliva showed a low amount of the coronavirus in a preliminary test result, was not infected, the U.S. Department of Agriculture said on Monday. So far, there have been no confirmed coronavirus infections of any dogs in the U.S. https://t.co/vDWX9yLxCw

name: nytimes
text: The Minnesota Freedom Fund, which pays bail for those who cannot afford it and received online support from some celebrities, took in a remarkable $20 million in a matter of days — so much that its website was now encouraging donors to give elsewhere https://t.co/qJM6JNCbmm
